fields.caption:
**Ask the Editors**

 Want to get in touch with a specific member of the Teen Vogue team? [Email us!](http://www.teenvogue.com/contact/tellus)



**Modeling Policy**

 Teen Vogue works with established modeling agencies to cast talent in our editorials. We do NOT recruit models via TeenVogue.com, Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, email, or anywhere online. Please see our [model policy](http://www.teenvogue.com/magazine/2011/model-policy) and [send us an email](http://www.teenvogue.com/contact/tellus) if you’ve been contacted by a representative claiming they are from Teen Vogue.



**Subscription Questions**

 If you have questions about your subscription, check out our [customer care](https://w1.buysub.com/pubs/N3/TNV/login_3_methods.jsp?cds_page_id=10531&cds_mag_code=TNV&id=1344392260198&lsid=22202117150023600&vid=2) page or e-mail [TNVcustserv@cdsfulfillment.com](mailto:TNVcustserv@cdsfulfillment.com).



**Email the Webmaster**

 Having a technical problem with the site? Link down? [Let us know about it](http://www.teenvogue.com/contact/contact_tnv)! If you’re wondering about advertising or anything else, [send in a V-Mail](http://www.teenvogue.com/contact/tellus).



**Press Inquiries**

 Contact our Senior Public Relations Director [Erin Kaplan](mailto:Erin_Kaplan@condenast.com).



**Sweepstakes Inquiries**

 Interested in learning more about our Win It section? [Email us](mailto:sweepstakes@teenvogue.com)!

items.hed: Check Out The Most Gorgeous Beauty Moments From NYFW
items.dek: Because backstage is closer than the front row.

items.caption: [New York Fashion Week Spring/Summer 2016](http://www.teenvogue.com/tag/new-york%20fashion%20week) in full-drive, and that means the most epic beauty inspiration. Each day, the Teen Vogue beauty team is going backstage behind-the-scenes to talk all things makeup, hair, and skin with the top glam squads in the entire world. Which means that, in addition to previewing all the amazing clothes that will float down the runway, we get the first look at the prettiest trends that will most likely make their way into beauty's mainstream in the coming months. Right this way for the epic gorgeousness.

items.title: Ralph Lauren
items.caption: “The Ralph Lauren woman is always very classic and luxurious, so the hair is super simple and beautiful with this rich texture since it was just washed,” says hair legend Guido Palau on the unfussy hair moment at Ralph Lauren. The flushed, luminous skin and barely-there makeup makes this the perfect school day situation.

items.title: Marc Jacobs
items.caption: The ‘40s-glam-meets-downtown-grunge inspiration at Marc Jacobs called for haphazard, shiny chignons, clumpy mascara, and smudges of blue eye paint.

items.title: Calvin Klein
items.caption: Sometimes bold brows and simplistic makeup are all you need. Here's proof.

items.title: Anna Sui
items.caption: Inspired by Tahitian paintings, the mood at Anna Sui was totally boho, with a twist. “I wanted the women to look as if they had spent a day at the beach and swam in the ocean,” said hair superstar Garren of the hair look. Deep, berry lips added an unexpected evening element to the relaxed feel.

items.title: Anna Sui
items.caption: Can you even handle the amazingness of this floral headwear? Booking a trip to somewhere exotic, STAT.

items.title: Michael Kors
items.caption: Warm, luminous skin was achieved when makeup artist Dick Page swept Michael Kors Bronzer along the models' cheekbones. Windblown, simple strands completed the classic Kors elegance.

items.title: Michael Kors
items.caption: A sunny Kendall Jenner moment backstage is always a Fashion Week highlight.

items.title: Proenza Schouler
items.caption: Strong, confident, and passionate were the adjectives hair pro, Anthony Turner, used to describe the Proenza Schouler girl. The designers always cast the most gorgeous newcomers for each and every one of their shows.

items.title: Proenza Schouler
items.caption: Natural skin with an effortless lit-from-within quality is always best when freckles show through.

items.title: DKNY
items.caption: This grown up moment for DKNY was a #TBT to the ‘90s supermodels and old Peter Lindbergh photographs. Maybelline makeup master, Yadim, created the perfect bold lip statement by coating models’ pouts with [Maybelline Lip Studio Color Blur in Cherry Cherry Bang Bang](http://www.drugstore.com/maybelline-lip-studio-color-blur-cherry-cherry-bang-bang/qxp558388) and then adding a layer of Maybelline Color Sensational Vivid Matte Liquid in Rebel Red (out in January). Set against super-slick, side-parted hair and epic power suits, the girls looked as sophisticated as it gets.

items.title: Rodarte
items.caption: The poetic beauty at Rodarte was straight out of a fairytale. Makeup artist, James Kaliardos for Nars, went for a monochromatic dewy makeup look. His hero product? [Nars Craving Dual-Intensity Blush](http://www.narscosmetics.com/USA/craving-dual-intensity-blush/0607845055044.html). He simple ran an angled brush through the two-sided palette and swept it along the models' cheekbones. Instant contour, minus the stripes. Hair guru Odile Gilbert adorned the models’ hair by placing gilded barrettes in unexpected places. Paired with texturized strands (achieved using Kerastase Powder Bluff), the overall feel was edgy, yet romantic.

items.title: Coach
items.caption: Relaxed cool was the aesthetic at Coach. Hair legend, Guido Palau, spritzed strands with [Redken’s One United](http://www.ulta.com/ulta/browse/productDetail.jsp?productId=xlsImpprod12541003&skuId=2290073&cmpid=PS_Non!google!Product_Listing_Ads&cagpspn=pla&CAWELAID=330000200000301601&catargetid=330000200000333055&cadevice=c&gclid=CjwKEAjwpuSvBRDSkaes4OasuEESJACfwIc_piAoOmp2nXMMFeTHbfdPWVqnyoONudnQuZtyDrzYMxoCpIvw_wcB) for softness and then enhanced texture with [Redken Fashion Waves](http://www.redken.com/products/styling/texture/fashion-waves-07). The center-parted ‘dos feel totally achievable, yet utterly beautiful.

items.title: Coach
items.caption: What do you pair with mussed hair and spring’s coolest layered fashion pieces? Dewy, perfect skin and just-bitten lips.

items.title: Sophie Theallet
items.caption: Makeup artist Tom Pecheux was responsible for the rock ’n’ roll-meets-gypsy eye moments at Sophie Theallet. He paired smoky lids with foundation-less skin for a fresh-yet-impactful statement.

items.title: Vera Wang
items.caption: French girl beauty was the name of the game backstage at Vera Wang. Hair master, Eugene Souleiman, gave each model a choppy, fringed jet-black wig and Clé de Peau Beaute Makeup Creative Director, Lucia Pieroni, complemented the shags with dewy skin and lemony shadow. Playful-yet-dark? Check.

items.title: Jeremy Scott
items.caption: “Jeremy wanted the girls to look big. We decided to do really crazy, big hair. It’s inspired by John Waters who made the film *Hairspray*. It’s massive and larger-than-life,” says Wella Professionals global creative director, Eugene Souleiman. Souleiman teased bleached blonde, red, and black wigs to over-the-top heights to create major volume and perfect bounce as the models marched down the runway.

items.title: Jeremy Scott
items.caption: MAC makeup genius, Kabuki, painted eyelash extensions on every girl using [MAC Liquidlast liner in Point Black](http://www.maccosmetics.com/product/13838/1250/Products/Makeup/Eyes/Liner/Liquidlast-Liner) for a ‘60s feel, and he left the rest of the face super fresh. The nails were all about “plastic is fantastic.” Miss Pop painted cartoon-inspired, rubbery, shiny manis in bright OPI colors, topped off with a pop art nail art glare on each pinky.

items.title: Thom Browne
items.caption: Thom Browne’s beauty moments are always epic and unexpected, but for his Spring 2016 show, he really outdid himself. The geisha-inspired makeup and upside down schoolgirl pigtail braids were totally beyond. Have you every seen anything more topsy-turvy?

items.title: Aya Jones
items.caption: Sporty, military-inspired, tight messy knots complete with windswept face-framing pieces and the most glowy, radiant skin has us longing for this easy elegance come Spring.

items.title: Tommy Hilfiger
items.caption: Last-days-of-summer vibes at Tommy Hilfiger as translated by makeup master Pat McGrath mean bronzy, highlighted skin, groomed brows, and lots of mascara. “They’re rock chicks in the sun, in Mustique,” McGrath explains. Eugene Souleiman even braided colorful peekaboo hair wraps through strands for the ultimate island feel. We’ll take two tickets to paradise.

items.title: Tommy Hilfgier
items.caption: [CoverGirl Minerals Loose Bronzer in Medium](http://www.target.com/p/covergirl-trublend-naturally-luminous-bronzer-golden-sunrise/-/A-14356497?ci_src=17588969&ci_sku=14356497&ref=tgt_adv_XSG10001&AFID=google_pla_df&CPNG=pla_health+beauty+shopping&adgroup=sc_health+beauty&LID=17pgs&KID=9050e5d9-6275-44e5-9a2b-146de0ccc510&kpid=14356497&gclid=Cj0KEQjwg9-vBRCK7L7wmO2u0JcBEiQA_tzoaIJA8EVzuT28SJ0KcyCfFdoH3p7nLI6rWUxgsW2TwNgaAtb-8P8HAQ) creates an instant vacay glow. Paired with tousled, beachy hair, this effortless look is an A+ in our book.

items.title: 3.1 Phillip Lip
items.caption: Clean, earthy skin was juxtaposed with a unique approach to liner backstage at 3.1 Phillip Lim. Makeup artist Francelle Daly for Nars, drew partial strokes of black or blue lines on the top and bottom lids. The colorful nets and gritty loose updos added to the cool effect.

items.title: Thakoon
items.caption: Luminous skin and early ’90s blowing-in-the-wind strands — does it get any prettier than this?

items.title: Prabal Gurung
items.caption: Simple elegance, embodied. There’s nothing more glamorous than a Prabal Gurung girl.

items.title: Diane Von Furstenberg
items.caption: Butterfly-inspired blue and green shimmery shadow and brushed out mega-curls topped with floral accessories are the ultimate prom look. Pinning this to our inspiration boards, stat.

items.title: Rebecca Minkoff
items.caption: The hottest accessory of the season? Shaggy, lash-grazing fringe. Make that haircut appointment, stat.

items.title: Victoria Beckham
items.caption: Beckham has made the timeless case that red lipstick is the only product you need to turn up the pretty.

items.title: Monique Lhuillier
items.caption: Color outside the lines! This season, say bye-bye to black liner and try a bright blue or green. It’s seriously eye-opening.

items.title: Givenchy
items.caption: Givenchy showed in NYC this season and besides the spectacular clothes, we couldn’t wait to see what legendary makeup artist, Pat McGrath, would do. She always creates next-level, genius looks that take beauty to a whole different sphere, and this season’s embellished face masks honestly stole the show (And the month! And our hearts!).

items.title: Givenchy
items.caption: Have you ever seen anything as gorgeous as this crystallized face mask situation? It’s truly a work of art.

items.title: Givenchy
items.caption: The ornate, luxurious makeup in motion on the runway. The show was a celebration of love, and we couldn’t love it more.

items.title: Givenchy
items.caption: [Kendall Jenner](http://www.teenvogue.com/gallery/best-runway-street-style-celebrity-moments-nyfw-day-1) took the runway for her first show of the season and looked quite different than normal. Her bleached brows gave her an alien vibe. Also, is dying your arches the new Jenner sister trend? [Kylie](http://www.teenvogue.com/story/kylie-jenner-bleaches-her-brows-on-snapchat) just did it, after she debuted her new blonde ‘do. But for Kendall, this brow switch-up was only for the show. A mere hours later, her dark-as-night bold brows were back on her (and on [Instagram](https://instagram.com/p/7gtvrLjo7Y/?taken-by=kendalljenner)).
items.credit: Photo: Antonio de Moraes Barros Filho/FilmMagic

items.title: Jason Wu
items.caption: Backstage at Jason Wu, we instantly fell in love with the red velvet lips created by makeup master, Yadim, and Maybelline. He left the models' skin dewy and glowy, and made a real statement with their pouts. First, he applied Maybelline Vivid Matte Liquid Lipstick (out in 2016) in two shades, one on the orange side, one a bit more blue, for the perfectly balanced red. Next, he overdrew the models’ lips ever-so-slightly for a fuller appearance. And then, for the coolest textural element, he pressed a cherry-hued pigment powder on top. “It makes it feel more modern,” he explained. Yadim recommends trying a loose eyeshadow or blush for a similar effect.

items.title: Creatures of the Wind
items.caption: Makeup artist [Aaron de Mey](https://instagram.com/aarondemey1/?hl=en) for [Nars Cosmetics](https://instagram.com/narsissist/) created the most out-of-this-world glam rock liner look. For some of the models, he topped the extended inky feline flick with a coating of punk rock gold glitter. Paired with a bright, fire engine-red lip…this is what beauty dreams are made of.

items.title: Creatures of the Wind
items.caption: “The look was inspired by singer, Siouxsie Sioux. She always had a very strong eye look — it had the same spirit, but was applied differently each time. The look is very eclectic with a lot of layering, which plays off the layering in the collection,” says de Mey. He used a combination of [Nars Black Valley Eye Paint](http://www.narscosmetics.com/USA/black-valley-eye-paint/0607845081418.html#q=black+valley&start=1), [Black Moon Eyeliner Pencil](http://www.narscosmetics.com/USA/black-moon-eyeliner-pencil/0607845080039.html#q=black+moon&start=4) and [Via Veneto Larger Than Life Eyeliner](http://www.narscosmetics.com/USA/via-veneto-larger-than-life-long-wear-eyeliner/0607845080510.html#q=via+veneto&start=4) to achieve this punky eye moment.

items.title: Creatures of the Wind
items.caption: “It's punk...tough looking. I love the richness of the gold against the toughness of the black. It’s an updated, modernized take on eyeliner,” says De Mey. We couldn’t agree more. And although this might not be school-appropriate, we think that whenever you can incorporate edgy sparkles into your look, why wouldn’t you? Use [Nars Eye Paint in Iskander](http://www.narscosmetics.com/USA/iskandar-eye-paint/0607845081500.html), then press the shimmer and shine up to your brow for a graphic effect. Wear your hair mussed up like the models at the show for an effortlessly cool vibe.

items.socialTitle: Check Out The Most Gorgeous Beauty Moments From NYFW
items.socialDescription: Because backstage is closer than the front row.
items.seoTitle: The Best Beauty Moments at New York Fashion Week
items.seoDescription: Best hair and makeup looks from New York Fashion Week Spring/Summer 2016.

fields.name: Emily Gaynor
fields.bio:
__What sort of advice would you give your 18-year-old self?__ 

I wish I would have known that everything works out in the end and if it didn’t, it most likely wasn’t meant to be. I stressed out over a lot of things—looking back I realize how big a waste of time that is. 

__What’s your favorite Teen Vogue moment?__ 

I have so many amazing *Teen Vogue* memories. I think my favorite was assisting on the Leighton Meester February 2009 cover shoot back when I was an intern. I was obsessed with Gossip Girl, and being on set in the LES with Leighton and Patrick Demachelier was definitely one the highlights of my entire college experience. At one point I had to stop pedestrians from walking into the shot and I remember thinking I’ve made it. Haha.

__Share a funny anecdote from a first job or internship.__ 

On my first day of my first internship, EVER, at *Teen Vogue* my purse hit the elevator alarm and the elevator stopped mid-ride—it was completely packed, too. I was mortified.  

__What beauty product are you loving right now?__

I can’t get enough of the Maybelline Master Kajal black liner. I love kohl-rimmed liner and this one is perfect. I also love that as it wears down you get an even more smudgy, smoky, rock ’n’ roll vibe. It’s basically the gift that keeps on giving. 

__What fashion item seems to always be on your shopping list?__ 

I can never have enough pairs of black jeans, but right now I’m in the market for overalls, culottes and a denim dress. 

__What’s your go-to karaoke song?__ 

"You Oughta Know” by Alanis Morissette, of course. 

__Who’s your favorite model and why?__ 

Well, it’s hard to pick, because I love models. But right now, I’m loving Cat McNeil. She’s confident, quirky and has amazing tattoos. 

__What’s your favorite Instagram to follow (other than Teen Vogue)?__ 

I follow a ton of models that I love, but right now my favorite Instagram is [@theacademynewyork](https://instagram.com/theacademynewyork/). They post really out-there images and quotes. And anything cat-related is always an instant-follow. 

__What’s your favorite meal?__ 

Tacos! All day, every day.
fields.title: Digital Beauty Editor
